items.title: Donald Trump–Xi Jinping: The complicated sale of TikTok to American investors
items.standfirst: Following a call with Xi Jinping, Donald Trump stated on Friday that finalizing an agreement on TikTok could now be a “simple formality” and confirmed his plans to visit China, though Beijing offered a much more measured account of the talks. Vedika Bahl tells us more.
items.content: Following a call with Xi Jinping, Donald Trump stated on Friday that finalizing an agreement on TikTok could now be a “simple formality” and confirmed his plans to visit China, though Beijing offered a much more measured account of the talks. Vedika Bahl tells us more.

items.title: Donald Trump Is Saying There’s a TikTok Deal. China Isn’t

items.content: Donald Trump claimed victory on a deal that would put TikTok in the hands of his allies after a call with Xi Jinping. But details on the agreement—and Beijing’s buy-in—remain murky.

items.content: President Donald Trump said that his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping had given approval to a sale of TikTok’s US operations to American investors, though he acknowledged that some final steps still need to be worked out.

items.content: President Donald Trump has said he hopes to see Bagram Airfield in Afghanistan returned to U.S. control, suggesting a renewed American presence in the country now again ruled by the Taliban.

items.content: President Donald Trump is set to speak with Chinese leader Xi Jinping on Friday as they try to finalize a deal to keep the popular short-video app TikTok operating in the United States.

items.title: Starmer to announce recognition of Palestinian state on Sunday, UK media reports say
items.standfirst: UK Prime Minister is expected to formally recognise a Palestinian state on Sunday, according to UK media reports. Starmer said in July that the move would contribute to a two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, something vehemently opposed by the Israeli government.
items.content: UK Prime Minister is expected to formally recognise a Palestinian state on Sunday, according to UK media reports. Starmer said in July that the move would contribute to a two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, something vehemently opposed by the Israeli government.

items.standfirst: The UK and Portugal were on Sunday expected to recognise a Palestinian state ahead of the UN General Assembly meeting in New York this week, where the so-called two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict will be front and centre. Thousands of Gazans on Saturday continued to flee Gaza City, the focus of the Israeli military’s expanded offensive. Follow our liveblog for the latest developments.

items.title: Heathrow flights delayed and cancelled as cyber-attack hits European airports
items.standfirst: Attack raises questions over security as Brussels and Berlin airports’ check-in and boarding systems also affectedFlights have been delayed and cancelled at three leading European airports – including London’s largest, Heathrow – after the company behind the software used for check-in and boarding said it was hit by a cyber-attack.Airports in Brussels and Berlin are also experiencing delays and disruption as a result of the problem affecting Collins Aerospace, which works for several airlines at airports across the world. Continue reading...
items.content: Attack raises questions over security as Brussels and Berlin airports’ check-in and boarding systems also affectedFlights have been delayed and cancelled at three leading European airports – including London’s largest, Heathrow – after the company behind the software used for check-in and boarding said it was hit by a cyber-attack.Airports in Brussels and Berlin are also experiencing delays and disruption as a result of the problem affecting Collins Aerospace, which works for several airlines at airports across the world. Continue reading...

items.title: Poland scrambles aircraft as Russia attacks Ukraine with hundreds of drones and missiles – as it happened
items.standfirst: This blog is now closed, you can read more on the war in Ukraine hereAt least 10 flights were cancelled out of Brussels airport and another 17 delayed by over an hour after the system was hit by a “cyber-attack” overnight on Friday, the airport said.EasyJet, among Europe’s biggest airlines, said it was currently operating as normal and did not expect the problem to impact its flights for the rest of the day, Reuters reports.Information on the situation is being continuously gathered, and Polish authorities are in contact with authorities in other countries. Continue reading...
items.content: This blog is now closed, you can read more on the war in Ukraine hereAt least 10 flights were cancelled out of Brussels airport and another 17 delayed by over an hour after the system was hit by a “cyber-attack” overnight on Friday, the airport said.EasyJet, among Europe’s biggest airlines, said it was currently operating as normal and did not expect the problem to impact its flights for the rest of the day, Reuters reports.Information on the situation is being continuously gathered, and Polish authorities are in contact with authorities in other countries. Continue reading...

items.title: Cyberattack at major European airports: "Brussels airport is the worst affected"
items.standfirst: "Brussels airport is the worst affected by this outage", said Dave Keating, FRANCE 24's Correspondent in Brussels, Belgium. "There are lots of scenes of chaos at the airport with lots of flights cancelled and lots of flights delayed. The airport is telling people 'don't come, unless you have it confirmed that your flight is actually taking off'."
items.content: "Brussels airport is the worst affected by this outage", said Dave Keating, FRANCE 24's Correspondent in Brussels, Belgium. "There are lots of scenes of chaos at the airport with lots of flights cancelled and lots of flights delayed. The airport is telling people 'don't come, unless you have it confirmed that your flight is actually taking off'."

items.title: Cyberattack disrupts major European airports, the latest from Brussels
items.standfirst: Airports across Europe, including London’s Heathrow, are warning of delays after a “technical issue” disrupted check-in and boarding systems. Brussels Airport attributed the problem to a cyberattack, reporting 10 flight cancellations and delays of over an hour for 17 additional flights. France24 Benedicte Paviot reports from London. Dave Keating reports the latest from Brussels.
items.content: Airports across Europe, including London’s Heathrow, are warning of delays after a “technical issue” disrupted check-in and boarding systems. Brussels Airport attributed the problem to a cyberattack, reporting 10 flight cancellations and delays of over an hour for 17 additional flights. France24 Benedicte Paviot reports from London. Dave Keating reports the latest from Brussels.

items.title: Cyberattack causes flight delays, cancellations at major European airports
items.standfirst: At least three European air hubs including Brussels, Berlin and London’s busy Heathrow airport reported flight delays and cancellations because of a “cyber-related disruption” on Saturday, according to airport service provider Collins Aerospace.
items.content: At least three European air hubs including Brussels, Berlin and London’s busy Heathrow airport reported flight delays and cancellations because of a “cyber-related disruption” on Saturday, according to airport service provider Collins Aerospace.

items.standfirst: Local and federal agents, including immigration officials, may not wear masks while conducting official businessCalifornia will be the first state to ban most law enforcement, including federal immigration agents, from covering their faces while conducting official business under a bill signed by the state’s governor, Gavin Newsom, on Saturday.The ban is California’s direct response to a recent series of immigration raids in Los Angeles where federal agents wore masks while making mass arrests. The raids prompted protests and led Donald Trump to deploy national guard troops and marines to the city. Continue reading...
items.content: Local and federal agents, including immigration officials, may not wear masks while conducting official businessCalifornia will be the first state to ban most law enforcement, including federal immigration agents, from covering their faces while conducting official business under a bill signed by the state’s governor, Gavin Newsom, on Saturday.The ban is California’s direct response to a recent series of immigration raids in Los Angeles where federal agents wore masks while making mass arrests. This is the first Southeast Asia expansion for the companies.

clusters.title: Luigi Mangione’s lawyers attack Pam Bondi for turning his arrest into a ‘Marvel movie’ that fatally prejudiced his case

items.title: Luigi Mangione’s lawyers attack Pam Bondi for turning his arrest into a ‘Marvel movie’ that fatally prejudiced his case
items.standfirst: Luigi Mangione’s lawyers urged a judge on Saturday to bar federal prosecutors from seeking the death penalty in the killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, arguing that authorities prejudiced his case by turning his arrest into a “Marvel movie” spectacle and by publicly declaring their…
items.content: Luigi Mangione’s lawyers urged a judge on Saturday to bar federal prosecutors from seeking the death penalty in the killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, arguing that authorities prejudiced his case by turning his arrest into a “Marvel movie” spectacle and by publicly declaring their…

items.title: Luigi Mangione’s lawyers seek to bar possibility of death penalty in federal case
items.standfirst: Lawyers argue authorities prejudiced the case against Mangione by turning arrest into a ‘Marvel movie’ spectacleLuigi Mangione’s lawyers urged a judge on Saturday to bar federal prosecutors from seeking the death penalty in the killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, arguing that authorities prejudiced the case against him by turning his arrest into a “Marvel movie” spectacle and by publicly declaring their desire to see him executed.Fresh from a legal victory that eliminated terrorism charges in Mangione’s state murder case, his lawyers are now fighting to have his federal case dismissed, seizing on US attorney general Pam Bondi’s declaration prior to his April indictment that capital punishment is warranted for a “premeditated, cold-blooded assassination that shocked America”. Continue reading...
items.content: Lawyers argue authorities prejudiced the case against Mangione by turning arrest into a ‘Marvel movie’ spectacleLuigi Mangione’s lawyers urged a judge on Saturday to bar federal prosecutors from seeking the death penalty in the killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, arguing that authorities prejudiced the case against him by turning his arrest into a “Marvel movie” spectacle and by publicly declaring their desire to see him executed.Fresh from a legal victory that eliminated terrorism charges in Mangione’s state murder case, his lawyers are now fighting to have his federal case dismissed, seizing on US attorney general Pam Bondi’s declaration prior to his April indictment that capital punishment is warranted for a “premeditated, cold-blooded assassination that shocked America”. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Luigi Mangione's lawyers are trying to prevent the death penalty.
They argue authorities prejudiced the case against Mangione.
The lawyers cite the "Marvel movie" spectacle of the arrest.
They also object to public statements by authorities.
The case involves the killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson.

ai_summary: Democratic leaders want to discuss government funding before the September 30 deadline.
They seek a deal to extend Obamacare subsidies and reverse Medicaid cuts.

Funding is set to expire in ten days, prompting the Democrats' request.

clusters.title: 'Incredible' Kildunne turns on swagger as England reach World Cup final

items.title: 'Incredible' Kildunne turns on swagger as England reach World Cup final
items.standfirst: Ellie Kildunne is the face of the Women's Rugby World Cup. Against France, she finally delivered the A-list performance she is capable of.
items.content: Ellie Kildunne is the face of the Women's Rugby World Cup. Against France, she finally delivered the A-list performance she is capable of.

items.title: Kildunne and Jones shine as England beat France to reach final
items.standfirst: Ellie Kildunne scores two tries on her comeback as England dig deeper than they have all tournament to see off a stubborn France and book their place in a seventh successive Women's Rugby World Cup final.
items.content: Ellie Kildunne scores two tries on her comeback as England dig deeper than they have all tournament to see off a stubborn France and book their place in a seventh successive Women's Rugby World Cup final.

items.title: Dazzling Kildunne helps England grind down to France to reach World Cup final
items.standfirst: Ellie Kildunne marked her return with two moments of brilliance as England overcame a ferocious French challenge to claim a gritty 35–17 semi-final win and book their spot in the Women’s World Cup final against Canada.
items.content: Ellie Kildunne marked her return with two moments of brilliance as England overcame a ferocious French challenge to claim a gritty 35–17 semi-final win and book their spot in the Women’s World Cup final against Canada.

ai_summary: Ellie Kildunne scored two tries in her comeback performance for England.
England defeated France to secure a spot in their seventh consecutive final.
Kildunne's performance was described as "incredible" and "dazzling".
England won the semi-final match with a score of 35-17 against France.
The final match will be against Canada.

clusters.title: Israel attack on Yemeni newspaper was second deadliest on journalists ever recorded
clusters.neutral_headline: Israeli Attack on Yemeni Journalists Called Deadliest in Years

items.title: Israel attack on Yemeni newspaper was second deadliest on journalists ever recorded
items.standfirst: Press freedom group says ‘brutal and unjustified attack’ is deadliest since 2009 Maguindanao massacre in PhilippinesThirty one journalists and media staff were killed by Israeli strikes on newspaper offices in Yemen last week in what the Committee to Protect Journalists (CPJ) said on Friday was the deadliest attack on journalists in the last 16 years.Israel struck a newspaper complex in Sana’a, Yemen’s capital, which housed three Houthi-connected media outlets on 10 September. At the time, members of the Yemeni army’s press arm were finishing the weekly print edition, according to the publication’s editor-in-chief, which increased the number of journalists present during the strike. Continue reading...
items.content: Press freedom group says ‘brutal and unjustified attack’ is deadliest since 2009 Maguindanao massacre in PhilippinesThirty one journalists and media staff were killed by Israeli strikes on newspaper offices in Yemen last week in what the Committee to Protect Journalists (CPJ) said on Friday was the deadliest attack on journalists in the last 16 years.Israel struck a newspaper complex in Sana’a, Yemen’s capital, which housed three Houthi-connected media outlets on 10 September. At the time, members of the Yemeni army’s press arm were finishing the weekly print edition, according to the publication’s editor-in-chief, which increased the number of journalists present during the strike. Continue reading...

items.title: Israeli killing of Yemeni journalists is deadliest attack on press in 16 years, watchdog says
items.standfirst: The Israeli airstrikes that killed 31 journalists and media support workers in Yemen earlier this month were the second-deadliest attack ever on the press, according to a report by the Committee to Protect Journalists, a global watchdog
items.content: The Israeli airstrikes that killed 31 journalists and media support workers in Yemen earlier this month were the second-deadliest attack ever on the press, according to a report by the Committee to Protect Journalists, a global watchdog

ai_summary: Israeli airstrikes killed 31 journalists and media workers in Yemen.
The attack is the second-deadliest on the press in history.
The Committee to Protect Journalists reported the attack's severity.
The attack targeted a newspaper complex housing Houthi-connected media outlets.
The attack occurred on September 10 in Sana'a, Yemen's capital.
